Detailed Description

ZeroMQ Socket.

Bindings info:
lib_name:'Socket_core' string_format:'%s (%s)' string_args:'(*userdata)->location(), (*userdata)->type()'

Definition at line 54 of file Socket.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

zmq::Socket::Socket ( int  type,
lubyk::Worker *  worker 
) [inline]

The worker is not provided by LuaObject before luaInit is called. This call happens after full object construction. We need the worker to set the zmq context, so we pass it as argument.

void zmq::Socket::bind ( const char *  location) [inline]

Bind a service to a location like "tcp://\*:5500" Should NOT be used while in a request() or recv().

bool zmq::Socket::hasEvent ( int  event) [inline]

Return true if the socket responds to the given event. This has to be used when we do not use zmq_poll but some external poll/select on the file descriptor.

bool zmq::Socket::rawSend ( lua_State *  L) [inline]

Sends raw bytes without using msgpack.

Returns:
false in case the send buffer is full.

Definition at line 275 of file Socket.h.

References data, and size.

LuaStackSize zmq::Socket::recv ( lua_State *  L) [inline]

Receive a message (blocks). Should NOT be used while already in a request() or recv(). For a server, this should typically be used inside the loop. We pass the lua_State to avoid mixing thread contexts.

Definition at line 235 of file Socket.h.

References msgpack_bin_to_lua().

LuaStackSize zmq::Socket::request ( lua_State *  L) [inline]

Request = remote call. Can be used by multiple threads.
